articles.title: Bulletin Printed in Bulgaria to Celebrate Feb. 16
Korean People's Just Cause Supported in India
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Supported in India 
    Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) expressed support and solidarity with the just cause of the Korean people at a mass rally held in New Delhi on Jan. 24 on the occasion of the "Day of Anti-Imperialism".
 Prakash Karat, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Party, in a speech bitterly denounced the U.S. imperialists for their moves for interference and aggression on Korea and expressed full support and solidarity with the just struggle of the Korean people.    
 Suneet Chopra, member of the Central Committee of the Party and joint secretary of the All-India Agricultural Workers' Union, in a speech explained how Korea has been divided by outside forces and demanded the U.S. immediately withdraw its aggression troops as well as weapons of mass destruction including nukes from south Korea.

Preparatory Committee Inaugurated in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee Inaugurated in Bulgaria 
    Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Bulgarian preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and Feb. 16 was formed in Sofia on Jan. 31.
 The secretary general of the Supreme Council of the Bulgarian Socialist Party was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful functions on the occasion of the above-said holidays.

articles.title: Appeal of Joint Meeting of DPRK Government, Political Parties and Organizations Supported
National Concord and Great Unity Called for
articles.content:
National Concord and Great Unity Called for 
    Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The special envoy of the Indonesian president visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Sunday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
 Present there were Nana Sutresna, special envoy of the Indonesian president who is a political counselor to the president, and his party and Bambang Irawan K., Indonesian charge d'affaires ad interim here.    
 The participants made a bow in humble reverence to Kim Il Sung who lies in state.
 Then they went round with deep emotion orders, medals and certificates of honorary titles of the DPRK and foreign countries he was awarded, the Mourner's Hall, a passenger train and a car he used during his on-the-spot guidance and foreign tour.
 The special envoy made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Indonesian President Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
Preparatory Committees to Commemorate Day of Sun and February 16 Formed
articles.content:
Preparatory Committees to Commemorate Day of Sun and February 16 Formed
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. made public a statement on Jan. 29 in support of the appeal to the whole Koreans which was adopted at a joint meeting of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations, according to the U.S.-based Internet homepage Minjok Thongsin.
 The statement fully supported the proposal of the DPRK to splendidly hold a grand joint festival of the nation for reunification with the attendance of representatives of political parties and organizations and authorities from the north and the south and abroad on the occasion of the anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration this year, single-mindedly united under the banner of "By our nation itself".
 The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. will make substantial efforts to make more organizations participate in the grand festival, the statement added.

DPRK Holidays to Be Marked by Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
DPRK Holidays to Be Marked by Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was formed on Jan. 30.
 Pak Kyong Ho, chairman of the united confederation, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold multifarious functions including a meeting, a film show, round-table talks and an art performance to widely introduce and glorify the undying revolutionary exploits and greatness of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il among Koreans in Kyrgyzstan on the occasion of the significant days.

articles.title: First National Sketch Festival Opens
articles.content:
First National Sketch Festival Opens
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- The first national sketch festival to celebrate February 16 was opened on Friday.
 More than 830 sketches selected at regional and institutional contests were presented to the festival held divided into the categories of experts and amateurs. 
 On display at the venue of the festival are "Visit to Field of Rich Harvest," "Giving Full Swing to Chollima," "Personally Seeing a Soldier's Album of Sketches," "Implanting Confidence and Optimism for Future," "Showing Marksmanship Worthy of a Crack Shot," "Native Home in Secret Camp of Mt. Paektu" and other sketches showing the undying revolutionary exploits of the three generals of Mt. Paektu. 
 Among sketches are "A Soldier of Mt. Osong," "Tradition of Assistance to Army," "Master of Miru Plain" and "First Casting" reflecting the heroic struggle of the Korean army and people and their patriotism. Also there are "I Want to Be a Soldier Fast" and "A Little Boy with a 'Military Dog'" showing the pretty features of schoolchildren and "Sokga Peak on Mt. Kumgang" and "Podok Rock on Inner Kumgang."
 Present at the opening ceremony held at the Pyongyang International Cultural Center were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education, Kim Kyong Ho, first secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and others.    
 After Minister of Culture Kim Jin Song made an opening address, the participants looked round the sketches on display.

DPRK Delegation Leaves for Talks with Japan
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Talks with Japan
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation led by Song Il Ho, ambassador in charge of DPRK-Japan talks of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, left here today for Beijing to attend the DPRK-Japan intergovernmental talks for the normalization of bilateral relations.
 It was seen off at the airport by officials concerned and the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

Special Envoy of Indonesian President Here
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Indonesian President Here
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Nana Sutresna, special envoy of the Indonesian president who is political counselor to the president, and his party arrived here today.
 He was met at the airport by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned and Bambang Irawan K., Indonesian charge d'affaires ad interim here.

articles.title: Paek Nam Sun Meets Special Envoy of Indonesian President
articles.content:
Paek Nam Sun Meets Special Envoy of Indonesian President
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun met and had a friendly talk with Nana Sutresna, special envoy of the Indonesian president who is political counselor to the president, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him on Feb. 4.
 On hand were officials concerned and the Indonesian charge d'affaires a.i. here.
